alert.note: Alert for Oswego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 08 at 7:31AM EDT until October 08 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive lake effect rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Oswego. * WHEN...Until 130 PM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - The lake effect band will lift northward throughout the morning and into this afternoon. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oswego, Sandy Island Beach State Park, Pulaski, Redfield, Selkirk Shores State Park, Mexico Point State Park, Nine Mile Point, Battle Island State Park, Hastings, Scriba, Richland, Palermo, New Haven, Minetto, Mexico, Williamstown, Orwell, Sandy Creek, Lacona and Parish. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
